intro: Grahamia australiana, commonly known as the Southern Grahamia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. This species is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant is perennial and thrives in well-drained soils, often found in coastal and sandy habitats. Its botanical features include narrow, grass-like leaves and a compact growth habit.
